markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Frying Pan](/Weapons.aspx?ID=517)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Fatal d8" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=597" />
<trait label="Halfling" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=621" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 190, [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 27 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 1 sp

**Damage** 1d4 B

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Simple

**Group** [Club](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=5)
</row>

</column>

---

The cast-iron frying pan is an essential tool for adventuring [halflings](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=5), gold panners, and remote tavern owners. Characters with the [Halfling Weapon Familiarity](/Feats.aspx?ID=55) ancestry feat are trained in the frying pan.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-5" />
name: Frying Pan
